save_chapter_1_intro: Interest can have a great impact on our personal finances, but the concept can be hard to understand. In this session, you will introduce the concept by using a small sweet as a example. You can then proceed to explain how it works in a monetary context and demonstrate how the savings bonus works in the app.
save_chapter_1_desc: Introduce the concept of interest using a small sweet.
save_chapter_1_step_1_desc: Give your child a sweet and explain 'If you donít eat this for one hour, then you'll get one more sweet'.
save_chapter_1_step_2_desc: Explain that getting interest is like getting the extra sweet. If you save your money, you'll get more.
save_chapter_1_step_3_desc: 'For every £10 that you save, you would get an extra 10p on Payday'
save_chapter_2_intro: Saving money is about being mindful of how we spend it. But by habit we often throw away our hard earned pennies without even realizing it. While spending £3 on a chocolate bar on a Saturday night may not seem like a big deal, doing so week after week would add up to a small fortune. In this session, you will challenge your family to save up for a fun family activity by cutting back on an unnecessary expense.
save_chapter_2_desc: Save up for a family activity by cutting back on buying sweets
save_chapter_2_step_1_desc: Agree on a fun family activity you'd like to do and research how much it will cost
save_chapter_2_step_2_desc: Divide the price of your goal with your weekly spend on sweets. That's how long you'll need to cut back to achieve your goal
save_chapter_2_step_3_desc: Have everyone help out, and keep track of your progress by crossing out each week in your calendar.
save_chapter_3_intro: Being frugal may seem like a negligible savings strategy, but when applied to everyday items it could amount to a fortune over time. A common challenge that we face when being frugal is achieving a balance between price and quality. You may be able to save £50  a year by switching to a cheaper toilet paper. But it may also mean that you need to lower your standards in terms of quality. Or does it? And is it worth it?
save_chapter_3_desc: Compare different toilet papers and discuss if it's worth being frugal.
save_chapter_3_step_1_desc: Try finding the cheapest and the most expensive toilet paper in terms of price per meter.
save_chapter_3_step_2_desc: Try the most expensive toilet paper you can find
save_chapter_3_step_3_desc: When you're out of expensive toilet paper, switch to the cheaper toilet paper.
save_chapter_3_step_4_desc: How much would you save in a year if you bought the cheaper toilet paper instead of the expensive one?
save_chapter_3_step_5_desc: Is the expensive toilet paper worth the extra cost? Or would you rather be frugal and save money?
earn_chapter_1_intro: Earning money is basically about finding solutions to problems that someone is willing to pay you for. Take, for instance, a hairdresser. They wouldn’t earn money unless some people thought it was worth while paying to get their haircut. In this session, you will challenge your child to practise problem solving. You will identify problems around the house, suggesting solutions and negotiating for a reward.
earn_chapter_1_desc: Identify and solve problems around the house.
earn_chapter_1_step_1_desc: List problems around the house. Is the lawn overgrown? Are the plants starting to look unhappy?
earn_chapter_1_step_2_desc: Try finding solutions to each of the problems on your list.
earn_chapter_1_step_3_desc: What are the problems on your list that are worth paying for them to be solved? And for how much?
earn_chapter_1_step_4_desc: Assign chores in the app, or have your child suggest them.
earn_chapter_2_intro: Earning money is usually associated with being employed. However, this isn't the only way. Some people earn their living by being entrepreneurs. An entrepreneur is someone who invests their time and money in creating and running a business. If the busienss is successful, they will earn more money than was invested. If the business is not successful, there is a risk of losing the money that was invested.
earn_chapter_2_desc: Set up your own cookie business.
earn_chapter_2_step_1_desc: Get what you need to run your cookie business, such as ingredients.
earn_chapter_2_step_2_desc: Let people know that you sell cookies. Let them also know where and when they can get them.
earn_chapter_2_step_3_desc: It is a good idea to keep records on how much you've spent and how much you've earned
earn_chapter_2_step_4_desc: After a day or a week, subtract the money you spent from money that you earned. Did you make a profit or loss?
earn_chapter_2_step_5_desc: If you make a profit, deposit the money to your child’s savings.
earn_chapter_3_intro: Selling old stuff we don’t use anymore is not only a somewhat sustainable way to declutter our homes, it’s also a way to earn some extra money.  Just because you don’t use something anymore, doesn’t mean that someone else won’t. Let it be a lesson if you don't get as much as you paid for it to begin with, you may think twice next time you buy something similar.
earn_chapter_3_desc: Clean out your home and sell things you don't use anymore.
earn_chapter_3_step_1_desc: While cleaning, try to find things that you don't use anymore.
earn_chapter_3_step_2_desc: Join a car boot sale or sell your unused items online. You can donate things that doesn't sell to charity.
earn_chapter_3_step_3_desc: How much did you pay for everything to begin with? Was it worth it given what you sold it for?
spend_chapter_1_intro: To spend our money wisely we must learn to prioritize what we need in life over other things that would be nice to have. But it’s not always obvious. Initially, snacks may feel essential for a Friday night. But this isn't the same if it means not being able to afford toothpaste. Because if you buy lots of snacks, you may end up having to pay extra for dental care further down the line. In this session, you will challenge your child to create a shopping list by achieving a balance between the needs and wants of your family.
spend_chapter_1_desc: Craft a shopping list and make a balance between needs and wants.
spend_chapter_1_step_1_desc: Make a list of items that you buy regularly and add in a couple of special purchases.
spend_chapter_1_step_2_desc: Divide the items on your list into what your family needs, and what you want but can do without.
spend_chapter_1_step_3_desc: Try narrowing down your list to half the items. Prioritising your choices in terms of needs and wants.
spend_chapter_1_step_4_desc: Go shopping together. Making sure to stick to your new list!
spend_chapter_2_intro: Budgeting is an essential skill, but it can be a hard lesson to learn. It’s so easy to spend small amounts of money. Challenging children to make decisions for a set amount of money is not only a great budgeting lesson, it's also a great way of learning how much things actually cost.
spend_chapter_2_desc: Make a budget for a family activity.
spend_chapter_2_step_1_desc: Decide on a budget. Let each family member share their ideas for activities you could do for with money.
spend_chapter_2_step_2_desc: Research the true cost of each idea. Make sure to include costs like transportation and food.
spend_chapter_2_step_3_desc: Agree on an activity and plan how to spend the money, making sure not to exceed your budget.
spend_chapter_2_step_4_desc: Save all receipts and compare with your budget. Did you spend more or less than expected?
spend_chapter_3_intro: To spend our money wisely, we must learn to make decisions based on what’s important to us. But this is not always obvious. Is it worth paying £50 for a pair of shoes when there are other shoes available £10? Maybe not. But on the other hand, what if the more expensive shoes fit you better and are much warmer?
spend_chapter_3_desc: Make a purchase decision based on important features.
spend_chapter_3_step_1_desc: Ask your child to find two pairs of shoes that they like and that are within your budget.
spend_chapter_3_step_2_desc: Come up with at least 3 features that are important for the purchase, such as design, quality and comfort.
spend_chapter_3_step_3_desc: Use your criteria to compare the shoes: 'This pair has a nicer design and better quality but they are not as comfortable'.
spend_chapter_3_step_4_desc: Agree on what shoes to buy based on how well they meet your criteria.
about_gimi_education_section_1: Sessions is a collection of activities for families to teach their young ones about money.
about_gimi_education_section_2: Each activity is divided into steps, follow them and mark the activity as done when completed. We use examples to make the activities more understandable. If the activities don't suit your family? Feel free to adapt them!
about_gimi_education_headline_3: Why do we recommend doing this?
about_gimi_education_section_3: Research suggests that children can learn good money habits and become money smart by being involved in family finances and conversations about money. Practicing money management together gives children the opportunity to learn skills necessary to help make well-informed financial decisions on their own in the future, whether it regards earning, saving or spending money.
save_chapter_4_intro: Saving money is one of the most important lessons to learn in life, and to learn we need to practice. But sometimes it can be difficult knowing where to start. In this session you will help your child to find a dream to start saving for.
save_chapter_4_desc: Find a dream that your child is motivated to start saving for.
save_chapter_4_step_1_desc: Ask your child to list everything he or she dreams about buying but can't afford right now.
save_chapter_4_step_2_desc: Sort the list from what feels most important to least important.
save_chapter_4_step_3_desc: Estimate how long it will take to save up for the most important item on the list.
save_chapter_4_step_4_desc: Is there a chance that priorities will likely change during that time? Would your child rather save for something else?
save_chapter_4_step_5_desc: Ask the child to create a dream in the app and make a plan for reaching it together.
earn_chapter_4_intro: Doing something we like and that we're good at can make work more fun. But it can be difficult finding what that something is. One way to find out is to explore our interests and to develop skills within these areas. In this session you will challenge your child to think about his or her interests and find ways to develop skills within these areas.
earn_chapter_4_desc: Explore interests and develop skills within those areas
earn_chapter_4_step_1_desc: Ask your child to write down what his or her interests are or what they like doing.
earn_chapter_4_step_2_desc: Find jobs that are associated with the interests on the list. An interest in food could lead to a career as a chef!
earn_chapter_4_step_3_desc: Find ways to practice the jobs. The first step to becoming a chef may be to cook Sunday dinner?
spend_chapter_4_intro: Learning to spend sustainably is important. Not only for our wallets, but also for our planet. A good start is to start thinking about the 3 Rs' Reduce, Reuse, Recycle.
spend_chapter_4_desc: Talk about how your family can spend more sustainably.
spend_chapter_4_step_1_desc: Agree on what purchases your family can cut back on. Items you often buy but don’t really need?
spend_chapter_4_step_2_desc: Agree on what purchases your family can cut back on. Items that you often buy but don't really need?
spend_chapter_4_step_3_desc: Agree on what items your family buy that should be recyclable.
spend_chapter_4_step_4_desc: Write down everything you agreed on and have every family member sign the agreement.
spend_chapter_5_intro: Some children can feel nervous making their first purchase at a shop. This session is for parents who wish to help their children make their very first payment with a card.
spend_chapter_5_desc: Help your child make their first payment with their new Gimi Card
spend_chapter_5_step_1_desc: Explain that to pay there must be sufficient funds on the card. Ask your child to check the balance.
spend_chapter_5_step_2_desc: Tell your child to check the amount on the machine and enter the chip or blip the card. Enter the PIN if necessary.
spend_chapter_5_step_3_desc: Explain that you need to save the receipt if you for any reason would want to return the item in the future.
spend_chapter_5_step_4_desc: Wait a couple of days. Then ask your child if the purchase was a success or regret. Did he or she learn anything?
earn_chapter_5_intro: There are so many jobs available. How can you know what you want to be doing in the future? For a child, a first step in the journey to figuring this out is to explore and learn more about all the available jobs. Therefore in this session you will challenge your child to spot and discuss jobs you come across around town.
earn_chapter_5_desc: Spot jobs around town, the first one who can spot 10 wins.
earn_chapter_5_step_1_desc: Take a trip downtown or somewhere else where you can see a lot of people working.
earn_chapter_5_step_2_desc: Who can first name 10 jobs based on the people you see and places you pass?
earn_chapter_5_step_3_desc: Did you spot a job that your child could see themself doing in the future? Make some research to find out what education and skills are needed.
save_chapter_5_intro: Albert Einstein once said 'Compound interest is the eighth wonder of the world. He who understands it, earns it. He who doesn’t, pays it.' But how do we learn to understand it? This session builds upon our earlier ’Introduce interest’ session. But this time you will take it further and explore the effect of earning interest on interest.
save_chapter_5_desc: Explain compound interest using some small sweets.
save_chapter_5_step_1_desc: Give your child a sweet and say: 'If you don't eat this sweet for 1 hour, you will get one more'.
save_chapter_5_step_2_desc: Explain that getting interest is like getting another sweet. If you save your money, you'll get more.
save_chapter_5_step_3_desc: Say 'Don't eat your two sweets for another hour and you'll get two more'.
save_chapter_5_step_4_desc: What if you keep going? How many sweets could your child have in another hour (eight)? Or in two hours (sixteen)?
save_chapter_5_step_5_desc: Explain that compound interest works the same way. You earn interest both on what you've saved and the interest you've previously earned.
spend_chapter_6_intro: Making the first purchase online can feel a bit scary for some children. This session is for parents who want to help their children make their very first online purchase with a card.
spend_chapter_6_desc: Help your child make their first online purchase
spend_chapter_6_step_1_desc: Make sure that you are shopping from a safe webpage.
spend_chapter_6_step_2_desc: Calculate the total price of the purchase, make sure to include delivery fees etc.
spend_chapter_6_step_3_desc: Explain that to pay there must be sufficient funds on the card. Ask your child to check the balance.
spend_chapter_6_step_4_desc: Choose card as the payment option and fill out the required information
spend_chapter_6_step_5_desc: Wait a couple of days after the delivery arrived. Ask your child if the purchase was a success or regret.
